gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players commandeer advanced airships in a near future where the survival of bees and the global ecosystem is at stake. The game combines strategic decision-making with environmental conservation, focusing on the crucial role bees play in our world.

blueTeam.name: The Bombus Navigators
blueTeam.description: Experts in navigation and ecosystem restoration.

redTeam.name: The Apis Aviators
redTeam.description: Specializing in bee preservation and environmental rehabilitation.

turns.scenario: Post-Hurricane Recovery: Bee habitats have been destroyed by recent hurricanes. Teams must decide on a restoration approach.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams chose to plant native flowers. The rapid bloom of these plants provides immediate nectar for bees, but leaves them vulnerable to future storms.

AB.narrative: By dividing responsibilities, the teams were able to effectively address multiple issues. The Apis Aviators planted flowers while The Bombus Navigators formed new colonies. Together they expedited recovery.

BA.narrative: Divided strategies worked here too. Bombus Navigators planted flowers while Apis Aviators established new colonies. The population started recovering.

BB.narrative: Both teams took a cautious route, establishing new colonies instead of risking another disaster. This ensures bee survival but leaves scant resources for them to gather.

turns.scenario: Wildfire Restoration: Recent wildfires have decimated bee habitats. Teams have a choice on how to approach recovery.

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to encourage ecological recovery.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to accommodate displaced populations.

AA.narrative: Both parties decide to heal the burnt landscape by sowing seeds. This endeavour breathes life back into the charred earth, providing a natural habitat for bees.

AB.narrative: While Bombus Navigators work to get nature back on its feet, Apis Aviators provide immediate relief by creating artificial habitats. Their combined effort accelerates both short and long-term recovery.

BA.narrative: Apis Aviators seed the fire-ravaged areas while Bombus Navigators provide a safe haven for the displaced bees. The result: a balanced response to a devastating disaster.

BB.narrative: Both teams establish artificial habitats, providing a quick solution for displaced bees but leaving an ecological void at the disaster site.

turns.scenario: Sustainable Expansion: Teams are now planning for the future, but must decide how to best promote bee survival.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology for optimal habitat conditions.
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams choose to invest in technology. Innovative beehive designs and high-tech monitoring systems ensure the survival and wellbeing of bee populations.

AB.narrative: Apis Aviators create bee sanctuaries while Bombus Navigators focus on public awareness. Each team's efforts seem to complement the other's, providing both protection and enlightenment.

BA.narrative: Bombus Navigators opt for technological solutions while Apis Aviators enlighten the public on the importance of bees. This balance of technology and education results in tangible change.

BB.narrative: Both teams channel their resources into public awareness. The world responds with enthusiasm and supportive action, safeguarding the future of bees.
